titleproper.value: Guide to the Malcolm Goldstein Papers <num>MSS.350</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-12-03T16:18:10</date>

abstract.value: Malcolm Goldstein is a composer and violinist primarily concerned with structured improvisation and a unique style which he calls "soundings." He writes graphic scores which combine elements of standard musical notation, calligraphy, written instructions, and collage. Goldstein has collaborated with many dancers, writers, and musicians, most frequently with Philip Corner and Allison Knowles. The Malcolm Goldstein Papers contais scores, documentation of performances, writings, publicity, and administrative documents relating to Goldstein's work as composer, musician, collaborator, writer, curator, and professor.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Malcolm Goldstein Papers; MSS 350; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

The Malcolm Goldstein Papers were donated to the Fales Library & Special Collections by Goldstein in 2012. Accretions were donated by Goldstein in 2013-2015, 2018, and 2019. Accession numbers associated with these donations are 2012.350, 2013.350, 2014.350, 2015.350, 2018.090, and 2019.044.

A 2018 accretion contains Goldstein's writings on the music of Charles E. Ives, specifically a 2016 booklet <emph render="italic"> Charles Ives -- String Quartet No. 2 -- Critical Edition </emph> which includes the booklet, as well as supporting work files with edited drafts, letters, notated scores, 1946 sound recordings of the piece, and reviewer notes. Concert programs and reviews of his performances from 2014 to 2016 and Goldstein interview transcripts and articles from 2016-2017 is also in this accretion. Material on Goldstein projects include 1992 Die Moltkerei Gallery original material and descriptions of his Moroccan Project from 2009. Updated copies of existing pieces in the collection as well as more recent works and performance notes for <emph render="italic">Wandering Still,</emph> <emph render="italic">This Full Breath/Gesture Sounding,</emph> and <emph render="italic">If Not Now, When?</emph> can also be found in this collection, dating from 2017 to 2018.

Series I: Music Projects263529Scope and Content

The Series comprises scores and documentation of performances. It is separated into three subseries: Projects A-Z, Other Musicians, and Notebooks and Sketches. Each subseries is described more fully below.

Subseries A: Projects A-Z263530Scope and Content

Subseries A: Projects A-Z contains scores, source material, and documentation of performances for music projects. Each project was labeled by Malcolm Goldstein and titles were transcribed from his notes.

Arrangement

Projects are listed alphabetically as they were upon arrival.

Subseries B: Other Musicians contains scores that are either made by other musicians specifically for Malcolm Goldstein to play or works of others that he created adaptations and critical editions of. Included in this series is material that was used for the critical edition of Charles Ives' work more of which can be found in Series II: Writing.

Arrangement

Material is arranged by surname of the musician whose piece is reflected therein.

Arrangement

Each notebook has been given a number that was imposed by the archivist. This number is used to connect each notebook with the loose pages that were within it and falling out. Series IX: Malcolm Goldstein's Notes on the Archive267693Scope and Content

Series IX comprises Malcolm Goldstein's notes describing his collection. In depth lists of music projects, media, and miscellaneous materials were often enclosed with boxes of material upon arrival and reveal more information about how material was originally categorized.

Arrangement

Materials have been arranged in the order of their corresponding series. For instance, listed information describing Series I: Music Projects was ordered first followed by notes on Series II: Writing. All inventories and lists marked "Miscellaneous" or with multiple entries are at ordered at the end.
